qas.question: Who became Chairman of the Council of Ministers in 1985?
Who was Chairman of the Council of Ministers prior to Ryzhkov?
How old was Tikhonov when he stopped being Chairman?
What is an analogous office to Chairman of the Council of Ministers?

answers.text: chairman of the State Planning Committee

qas.question: Who was the new chairman of the State Planning Committee in 1985?

context: In the fall of 1985, Gorbachev continued to bring younger and more energetic men into government. On September 27, <a0_0>Nikolai Ryzhkov<a0_0/> replaced <a2_0>79-year-old<a2_0/> <a1_0>Nikolai Tikhonov<a1_0/> as Chairman of the Council of Ministers, effectively the Soviet prime minister, and on October 14, <a4_0>Nikolai Talyzin<a4_0/> replaced Nikolai Baibakov as <a3_0>chairman of the State Planning Committee<a3_0/> (GOSPLAN). At the next Central Committee meeting on October 15, Tikhonov retired from the Politburo and Talyzin became a candidate. Finally, on December 23, 1985, Gorbachev appointed Yeltsin First Secretary of the Moscow Communist Party replacing Viktor Grishin.
